article.title: Time-resolved UVES observations of a stellar flare on the planet host HD 189733 during primary transit

multiple_choice_question.text: What observing condition shows an overall decrease over the four hours of observation?
choices: Airmass
Seeing
Flux
Resolution

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the shaded areas in the figure represent?
choices: Wavelength regions contaminated by telluric lines.
Two 1 Å wide intervals centered on the Ca II H & K line cores.
Two reference bands used for the determination of the log RHK index.
Areas of the spectrum excluded due to low signal-to-noise ratio.

multiple_choice_question.text: What event coincides with the middle of the transit duration (time=0 days)?
choices: Start of the primary flare rise phase.
Peak flux of the primary flare.
Peak flux of the secondary flare.
Start of the tertiary flare rise phase.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the black line in the bottom part of the figure represent?
choices: The quiescent reference spectrum of the Ca II K line.
The spectrum observed during the flare peak of the Ca II K line.
Flux residuals after subtracting the quiescent spectrum from the flare spectrum for the Ca II K line.
A Gaussian fit to the core emission of the Ca II K line during the flare peak.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the red solid lines represent?
choices: Observed Ca II IRT line profiles.
Synthetic model spectra of a photosphere.
Flux residuals after subtracting the model spectra from the observed spectra.
Gaussian fits to the core emission of the Ca II IRT lines.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which chromospheric line contributes the most to the total energy released during the flare?
choices: Hα
Ca II K
Ca II H
He I D3

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the difference between the dotted red line and the dashed black line in the upper part of the figure?
choices: The dotted red line represents the quiescent spectrum, while the dashed black line represents the spectrum during the activity peak.
The dotted red line represents the spectrum observed during the activity peak, while the dashed black line represents the quiescent spectrum.
The dotted red line represents the flux residuals after subtracting the quiescent spectrum from the active spectrum, while the dashed black line represents the Gaussian fit to the core emission.
The dotted red line represents the Gaussian fit to the core emission, while the dashed black line represents the flux residuals after subtracting the quiescent spectrum from the active spectrum.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which line shows a distinctly different temporal evolution during the flare compared to the other chromospheric lines?
choices: Hα
Ca II K
Ca II IRT 8498 Å
He I D3

multiple_choice_question.text: What happens to the He I D3 line during the decay phase of the primary flare event?
choices: It shows excess emission compared to the pre-flare level.
It shows absorption compared to the pre-flare level.
It remains at a constant equivalent width.
It disappears completely from the spectrum.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of this figure?
choices: To show the evolution of the He I D3 line equivalent width in comparison to other strong chromospheric lines.
To demonstrate that the observed behavior in the He I D3 line is not due to instrumental effects.
To compare the evolution of the He I D3 line during the flare with the evolution of the continuum.
To highlight the correlation between the He I D3 line and neighboring photospheric lines.
